description: From en- +â€Ž throne; compare earlier enthronize, inthronize.

verbs.description: enthrone (third-person singular simple present enthrones, present participle enthroning, simple past and past participle enthroned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put on the throne in a formal installation ceremony called enthronement, equivalent to (and often combined with) coronation and/or other ceremonies of investiture
(transitive, figuratively) To help a candidate to the succession of a monarchy (as a kingmaker does), or by extension in any other major organisation.
